Easily download data from the **ACC** below. Before downloading, you can apply multiple filters (e.g., taxonomic names, haploid/diploid count) to specify your request. More columns are available under 'Column visibility'


```{r echo=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
firstup <- function(x) {
  substr(x, 1, 1) <- toupper(substr(x, 1, 1))
  x
}
library(DT)
ACC<-read.csv('ACCDBJun28.csv')
colnames(ACC)<-firstup(colnames(ACC))
colnames(ACC)[c(7,9,11)]<-c("Species","2N", "N")

stp<-ACC[,-c(1,8,10,12)]
stp[,c(1:6)] <- lapply(stp[,c(1:6)], factor)

DT::datatable(stp, filter = 'top', rownames = FALSE, 
                              extensions = list(#'ColReorder' = NULL, 
                                                #'RowReorder' = NULL, 
                                                'Buttons' = NULL
                                                ), 
                              options = list(dom = 'Bfrtip', #scrollX = TRUE, autoWidth = TRUE, 
                                             #lengthMenu = list(c(10, 50, 100, -1), c('10', '50', '100', 'All')), 
                                             #ColReorder = TRUE, 
                                             #rownames= FALSE,
                                columnDefs = list(list(targets = c(0,1,8), visible = FALSE)),
                                             #rowReorder = TRUE, 
                                             buttons = list(
                                                            list(extend = 'collection', 
                                                                 buttons = c('csv', 'excel'), 
                                                                 text = 'Download',
                                                                 filename= 'ACCDB_download',
                                                                 exportOptions = list(
                            modifiers = list(page = "selected")
                          )), 'colvis')))




```
